Class NoteDiatonic

java.lang.Object
  Note
      NoteDiatonic

public class NoteDiatonic
extends Note

A note plays a single frequency. All notes in a song have the same duration. Diatonic notes are the same as regular notes, but diatonic notes must have no sharps or flats. A music box with only diatonic notes is a 15-note music box (as opposed to a normal, 30-note music box).

Version:
3.29.2018
Author:
Annabelle Perng

Method Detail

isDiatonicNote

public boolean isDiatonicNote(int value)
Checks if the note value given is a valid diatonic note. Diatonic notes have no sharps and flats, and their note names range from "C-1" to "C-3."

Parameters:
value - the 'value' of the note, which shows where the note stands relative to the other notes.
Returns:
true if the value corresponds with a diatonic note; otherwise, false
